workflow.name: AI-curated Indian marketing newsletter with RSS feeds and Gmail delivery
workflow.description:
## How it works
This workflow automatically generates a daily Indian marketing & advertising newsletter. It fetches articles from Campaign India and Economic Times BrandEquity feeds, merges them, and evaluates each story using an AI relevance filter. Only meaningful updates, such as brand launches, marketing campaigns, and changes to digital media, are retained.

Relevant stories are stored in an n8n Data Table and later used to build a clean HTML newsletter. Every day at 7:30 PM IST, the workflow composes the email and sends it via Gmail, with an optional SMTP fallback if Gmail fails. After sending, processed entries are removed to keep the next day‚Äôs digest fresh.


## Set up steps

- Add your Gmail and (optional) SMTP credentials.
- Update the recipient email inside the Gmail/SMTP nodes.
- Confirm the Data Table exists or let n8n create it automatically.
- Adjust schedule timing if you want the newsletter at a different time.
- Add or remove RSS feeds as needed (inside the brown ‚ÄúRSS Fetching Block‚Äù).

(Full explanations for each block are included as sticky notes inside the workflow.)

### By Deepak Singh
If you need help or want custom automations:
deepakbiz@outlook.com

parameters.text:
=You are a strict relevance filter for news articles.

INSTRUCTIONS:
- Reply only with: true or false
- No explanations, no punctuation, no newlines, no extra text

RELEVANT TOPICS:
- Brand or product launches
- New or upcoming advertising/marketing campaigns
- Digital media changes (strategies, platforms, or tools)

Evaluate the following article:

Title: {{ $json.title }}
Content: {{ $json.content }}
Snippet: {{ $json.contentSnippet }}

Is this article relevant? Respond with true or false only.

parameters.content:
## Get Latest News
**Fetches 4 marketing news feeds (ET + Campaign India).
You can add/remove RSS sources here.**

## Merge all
**Combines all RSS feeds into one list.**

## Process AND LOOP-OVER All News Items




































Each article is passed to the AI Agent.
The agent returns true/false based on strict marketing relevance rules (System Prompt).
Modify the prompt in AI Agent if you want different filtering criteria.

## Send Filtered News Using Gmail/SMTP Account





























These nodes creates a polished HTML newsletter using the latest filtered articles from the Data Table. 
The Code node formats the content with titles, links, publish dates, and snippets, producing the final subject and HTML body used for sending.
After the email is sent, the workflow deletes all Data Table rows where Output = true.

## Set up steps - What this workflow does!

This flow pulls the latest marketing news from Campaign India and ET BrandEquity, filters the useful stories with an AI relevance check, saves them to a Data Table, and sends a daily newsletter at 7:30 PM IST. After sending, it clears the used entries so the next email contains only new articles.


**How to set it up**
1. Add your Gmail account.
2. (Optional) Add SMTP if you want a fallback sender.
3. Update the ‚ÄúSend to‚Äù email address.
4. Create a Data Table in n8n, make sure the Data Table has all the columns as in 'Insert Roe' node or let n8n create it.
5. Change the schedule time if needed.
6. Add/remove RSS feeds in the ‚ÄúGet Latest News‚Äù group.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
